text: After finishing _Julia-Con: The Podcast_ I've serious podcast deficiency. Are there any Julia-related?

elements.text: I've serious podcast deficiency. Are there any Julia-related?

text:
I really hope that that becomes a regular part of future JuliaCons, Huda, Keno, and Nathan did such a great job!
There is also a series of Julia AMAs for beginners that I’d recommend.

elements.text:
I really hope that that becomes a regular part of future JuliaCons, Huda, Keno, and Nathan did such a great job!

text:
FWIW I'm planning on hosting one soon - I used to have a podcast about Ghost (the blogging platform) where I invited lots of guests. I've been trying to find a topic I want to talk about ever since. 

Question then - what would make a podcast about Julia interesting to you?

elements.text:
FWIW I'm planning on hosting one soon - I used to have a podcast about Ghost (the blogging platform) where I invited lots of guests. I've been trying to find a topic I want to talk about ever since. 

Question then - what would make a podcast about Julia interesting to you?

text:
Code For Thought (<https://feeds.buzzsprout.com/1326658.rss|https://feeds.buzzsprout.com/1326658.rss>) is due to do a run of episodes about Julia. At least 2 (I don't recall if it was expanded beyond that. I think it might have been, but I might be thinking of something else). 
I was recorded for one of them at the end/beginning of last year.
That was supposed to come out in April (and still might), but idk haven't heard anything lately.
I know there was a big backlog of recorded but not yet editted/released.

text:
<@UB7JS9CHF>, thank you. I thought it was a video thing only. But even if it is, I'll find a workaround.  I'll look into it. It'll probably work as audio as well
<@U017E1DLS6B> Awesome! I hope, you'll let me know once it's alive. Great question. Talking about coding is hard without the... you know... code to look into. But when I was listening to podcasts about Python, it helped me a lot. With a lingo, with understanding constraints, etc. So it can be anything like news about Julia, talk with people working in different fields - what are the challenges they face? Diving into the specific aspects, like testing? Packages maybe? Even about the unique aspects of Julia... I'm looking at it from the beginner's perspective. But I don't mind "aspirational" listening to a topic above my had as well.
<@U6A936746> Thank you, I'll look into it, but for practical reasons, I prefer to subscribe to things than looking for singular episodes.  The "Include Julia" podcast is bound to happen sooner or later. I'll wait :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: , thank you. I thought it was a video thing only. But even if it is, I'll find a workaround.  I'll look into it. It'll probably work as audio as well

Awesome! I hope, you'll let me know once it's alive. Great question. Talking about coding is hard without the... you know... code to look into. But when I was listening to podcasts about Python, it helped me a lot. With a lingo, with understanding constraints, etc. So it can be anything like news about Julia, talk with people working in different fields - what are the challenges they face? Diving into the specific aspects, like testing? Packages maybe? Even about the unique aspects of Julia... I'm looking at it from the beginner's perspective. But I don't mind "aspirational" listening to a topic above my had as well.
Thank you, I'll look into it, but for practical reasons, I prefer to subscribe to things than looking for singular episodes.  The "Include Julia" podcast is bound to happen sooner or later. I'll wait
